strategy.trend_analysis: The hashtag strategy incorporates current educational content trends like #LearnWithMe and #CreativeLearning, popular parenting themes like #ParentingHacks, and broad appeal tags like #CuteAnimals and #Animation. It also includes niche tags for educators and homeschoolers (#MathTeacherLife, #HomeschoolingResources) to target specific communities. The inclusion of #FamilyGuyStyleComedy leverages specific humor trends for that audience. The overall mix aims for discoverability across different user interests on Instagram.
strategy.engagement_strategy: Engagement is driven by direct calls to action like #MustWatch and #TagAFriendWhoNeedsThis, encouraging users to interact and share. The question-based hashtag #WhatsYourFavoriteNumber aims to spark conversation in the comments section, boosting post visibility through increased interaction.

usage_tips: On Instagram, aim for a mix of high, medium, and low-reach hashtags. Place the most important hashtags in the first comment or immediately after your caption for better organization.
Vary your hashtags across posts to reach different segments of your audience.
Monitor the performance of your hashtags to see which ones are driving the most engagement and adjust your strategy accordingly.
Consider creating a branded hashtag for your series to build community, e.g., #EpsilonsMathClass.
Ensure your content genuinely reflects the keywords used in your hashtags to avoid misleading your audience.

generation_metadata.topic: EPISODE 1: Numbers Are My Friends!! Show this as HUGE ANIMATED TITLE CARD at the beginning for 3 seconds with epic effects! Family Guy style comedy! Baby dragon professor Epsilon discovers his classroom has been turned into a NUMBER MUSEUM! Natural numbers are friendly counting cookies, integers are temperature-changing penguins, rationals are pizza-loving fraction friends, and irrational numbers are mysterious infinite artists drawing spirals! Dragon gives a hilarious guided tour explaining each number type with funny demonstrations and visual gags. Students learn number sets through comedy and memorable characters. Include dragon's witty commentary and educational jokes!
